question.title: Error: module java.base does not "opens java.util"
question.body:
I am migrating an application from Java 11 to Java 17, when running some tests I am facing the following issue:

java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.reflect.InaccessibleObjectException: Unable to make field private final java.lang.Object[] java.util.Arrays$ArrayList.a accessible: module java.base does not "opens java.util" to unnamed module @1fb19a0
            at com.twitter.chill.java.ArraysAsListSerializer.<init>(ArraysAsListSerializer.java:69)
            at org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.kryo.FlinkChillPackageRegistrar.registerSerializers(FlinkChillPackageRegistrar.java:67)
            at org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.kryo.KryoSerializer.getKryoInstance(KryoSerializer.java:512)
            at org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.kryo.KryoSerializer.checkKryoInitialized(KryoSerializer.java:521)
            at org.apache.flink.api.java.typeutils.runtime.kryo.KryoSerializer.copy(KryoSerializer.java:306)`

I found in the Apache Flink documentation the following: "JDK classes/internal must be explicitly allowed by the application when it is started, on a per-module basis, in the form of -–add-opens/-–add-exports JVM arguments."

I tried to run the tests using the JVM argument: --add-opens java.lang/java.util=ALL-UNNAMED

But I still getting the same issue.

Does anyone knows what should I do?
